abstract: Oracle’s unsolicited bid for the software maker, announced today, comes amid mounting competition from SAP of Germany and Microsoft.
snippet: Oracle’s unsolicited bid for the software maker, announced today, comes amid mounting competition from SAP of Germany and Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Oracle said today that it had made an unsolicited $6.66 billion bid for BEA Systems, but BEA said the offer was too low and was complicated by BEA’s investigation into its granting of stock options.

headline.main: BEA Says $6.66 Billion Bid by Oracle Is Too Low

abstract: Oracle said Friday it had bid $17 a share to acquire BEA Systems, a business-software maker that Carl Icahn has been urging to sell itself. In a news release, Oracle said its bid was “the culmination of repeated conversations with BEA’s management over the last several years,” adding that “we look forward to completing a friendly transaction as soon as possible.”
lead_paragraph: Oracle said Friday it had bid $17 a share to acquire BEA Systems, a business-software maker that Carl Icahn has been urging to sell itself. In a news release, Oracle said its bid was “the culmination of repeated conversations with BEA’s management over the last several years,” adding that “we look forward to completing a friendly transaction as soon as possible.”

abstract: When Oracle offered $6.7 billion for BEA Systems on Friday, one of the Street’s longest-running rumors finally turned into fact.
snippet: When Oracle offered $6.7 billion for BEA Systems on Friday, one of the Street’s longest-running rumors finally turned into fact.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street saw this one coming from a mile away. Or, at least, from five years away.

headline.main: For BEA, Years of Rumors Become Reality

abstract: Oracle‘s latest acquisition target, BEA Systems, is hardly rushing into its suitor’s arms.
lead_paragraph: Oracle‘s latest acquisition target, BEA Systems, is hardly rushing into its suitor’s arms.

headline.main: BEA Systems Says Oracle Bid Is Too Low
